Reviews.Title: “Cheating staff”
Reviews.Author: HappyTravelerAfrica
Reviews.Content: The hotel itself is lovely and the outdoor pool area great. Comfortable and spacious rooms could do with a make-over, even if only the soft furnishings. Great food in the restaurant and very helpful waiters. It was disheartening to see the Maitre D' unable to speak a word of English. Upon checking out, several of my meal bills had been altered by staff. Tip values were increased, in some instances to double what the actual coffee or meal cost. Management dealt with it promptly, but you do need to check your slips carefully.

Reviews.Title: “Rooms are lackluster but the hotel is nice. 24 hour restaurant and excellent fitness center.”
Reviews.Author: Matt P
Reviews.Content: My room is small, boring, and a bit worn out. The restaurant is open 24 hours which is great because I get up around 3am every morning. The fitness center is one of the best I've seen in a hotel anywhere. Service is overly courteous and polite and helpful.

Reviews.Title: “Best hotel in the South of Mexico City”
Reviews.Author: RolandofGilliad
Reviews.Content: I have stayed at this hotel many times when visiting Mexico City South and have enjoyed many of it's amenities. The food is excellent and the rooms are quiet and roomy. The only small down side is that the beds are very hard (I hear that a mattress cover helps) and the location is a bit isolated (hard to walk anywhere). However, the staff is very helpful and the hotel is first class which makes it the best choice in Mexico City South.

Reviews.Title: “Very Nice Hotel with Mexican Charm and Great Attention to Services”
Reviews.Author: isabelwolf
Reviews.Content: From the moment I arrived at the hotel I know that I would be happy. I have stayed in many hotels in Mexico City and this was among the best. The restaurants are excellent and 24 hour room service was extremely reasonable. Rooms and public areas are meticulously clean and maintained. Good security. Friendly, professional staff. Free WiFi, Slightly hard bed was quickly remedied with a mattress topper. Will be back!

Reviews.Title: “Luxury for a Great Value near my Distributor”
Reviews.Author: SalesKing
Reviews.Content: I have stayed here three times. This hotel is exceptionally clean and close to my distributor. It is safe, the staff are efficient and friendly and I consider it a safe haven in an otherwise grimy city.

Reviews.Title: “Nice Hotel - A few Complaints”
Reviews.Author: madera99
Reviews.Content: I stayed here for 3 nights in September for business. The hotel feels safe and is in a decent location. It is close to shopping and restaurants but a taxi is necessary. The room was big and modern. I think the bed was a little hard, but there is a large flat screen tv and the bathroom was very nice. The restaurant downstairs is decent. The menu is not big and the service is a little slow, but the food is fine. My biggest complaint about this hotel is the wireless internet service. It is horrible! All three days at the hotel- the service was spotty at best. I called the front desk and I believe they know they have problems with the wireless internet. (internet with an ethernet cable is not available). The front desk was very rude about the problem as it seemed as though they are also frustrated by it.

Reviews.Title: “Good experience, but...”
Reviews.Author: Dreloso
Reviews.Content: Stayed a week at the Royal while visiting my daughter who is a college student in Mexico City. Overall a very good experience. Price was same as I booked via Travelocity and the room was very nice and clean. Service was very good and the lobby restaurant was exceptional for a lobby restaurant. Nice pool and spa. Now for the however....lots of street noise at night even though the room is quite some distance off the street. The location is in a business complex area with no shops or restaurants within walking distance, so a taxi ride is necessary for everything. Finally, I arranged through the front desk for a taxi the airport at the end of our stay at a fixed rate. The driver did the classic and raised the price once we got to the airport. Overall a nice hotel and good experience.

Reviews.Title: “Watch for the hidden costs”
Reviews.Author: amedina
Reviews.Content: I stayed here at July 27 to 28 for a medical symposium. The hotel has nice installations, good pool and rooms. Its has several big meeting rooms and it seems this is one of its principal attractions. The room was not very clean, with stain marks in the bathroom. It had an old air conditioner and few TV channels. They offer wireless Internet for about $10 a day. The principal problem was they bill you for several of the accesories other hotels give you for free, like the toothbrush. I have no problem for this, but you can't differentiate between free and non-free accesories. You have to ask. Check-in services is good and speedy. And the hotel is easily accesible from one of the principal highways.
